content.1: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
content.2: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)
content.3: He left Judæa, and departed again into Galilee.
content.4: And he must needs go through Samaria.
content.5: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
content.6: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with
content.7: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her,
content.8: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
content.9: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.
content.10: Jesus answered and said unto her,
content.11: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?
content.12: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
content.13: Jesus answered and said unto her,
content.14: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.
content.15: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.
content.17: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her,
content.18: For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.
content.19: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
content.20: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
content.22: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.
content.23: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.
content.25: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.
content.27: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?
content.28: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,
content.29: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?
content.30: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.
content.31: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
content.33: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him
content.35: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and
content.36: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
content.37: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.
content.38: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.
content.39: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.
content.40: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.
content.41: And many more believed because of his own word;
content.42: And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard
content.43: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
content.44: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
content.45: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
content.46: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
content.47: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judæa into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.
content.49: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

content.52: Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
